message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a framework to enhance the robustness of deep neural networks using decision layer features. It also involves training binary classifiers on top of the proposed features, which is a common technique in machine learning. 

It is also likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision) as the experiments are conducted on standard image datasets (MNIST and CIFAR10) and involve additive perturbations to the images. 

The paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as it deals with the vulnerability of deep neural networks to adversarial examples and proposes a defense technique against them. 

It could also belong to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it involves the use of deep neural networks and machine learning techniques to detect adversarial examples. 

Finally, it may belong to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as it deals with the vulnerability of neural networks and proposes a technique to enhance their robustness.
